Question: I have a problem with terminal. When I click on the "terminal" icon on the left side, nothing happens - cursor just stays in wait mode for a few seconds. I tried to reinstall gnome-terminal from tty, but it didn't help. How can I fix it?

Question: I need to work on an existing Word 2007 addIn project that's a part of a MSVS 2008 solution. However, when I try to debug the addIn, I get the following error message: "You cannot debug or run this project, because the required version of the Microsoft Office application is not installed". I have Office 2007 installed.

I tried creating a new Word 2007 addIn project in the same solution, and I have no problem debugging it. As far as I can tell, all the referenced Office assemblies are the same between these two projects.

Referenced Office assemblies:

> 
> Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Visual Studio Tools for Office\PIA\Office12\Microsoft.Office.Interop.Word.dll)
> 
> 
> Microsoft.Office.Tools.Common.v9.0 (c:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\VSTO\v9.0\Microsoft.Office.Tools.Common.v9.0.dll)
> 
> 
> Microsoft.Office.Tools.v9.0 (c:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\VSTO\v9.0\Microsoft.Office.Tools.v9.0.dll)
> 
> 
> Microsoft.Office.Tools.Word.v9.0 (c:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\VSTO\v9.0\Microsoft.Office.Tools.Word.v9.0.dll)
> 
> 
> Office (c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Visual Studio Tools for Office\PIA\Office12\Office.dll)
> 
> 
> stdole c:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 9.0\Visual Studio Tools for Office\PIA\Office11\stdole.dll
> 
> 
> 

I tried rebuilding, starting debug under both Debug and Release configurations. Nothing helps. What else am I missing that could cause a problem with debugging the old project?

Answer:

The issue you're missing that could cause a problem with debugging the old project is likely a configuration setting. In this case, it seems to be the "stdole" in the Debugging configuration. The correct settings for the older Office assemblies (stdole) should match between these two projects. To resolve the issue, you're missing the correct settings for the "stdole" in the Debugging configuration. Specifically, the "stdole" in the Debugging configuration should be set to the Debugging configuration as follows:

- **Debugging Configuration**:
  - Set the "stdole" to the Debugging configuration.

Question: i am using youtube player api in android. How to hide more videos(Video Suggestions) from the player.

Answer:

1

To hide more videos(Video Suggestions) from the player in Android using YouTube Player API, the code snippet can be as follows:

```
import android.content.Intent
Intent intent = new Intent(Intent.ACTION_VideoPlayer)
intent.putExtra("hide_more_videos", true)
```

This code snippet is added to the Intent Extra to hide more videos(Video Suggestions) from the player.

Question: ![enter image description here](https://i.stack.imgur.com/crcjF.png)
![gparted screenshot 1](https://i.stack.imgur.com/bFVTA.png)

I can't figure out how to add all the "/dev/sda3" space to my /dev/sda1/ .. I tried everything, but /dev/sda1/ can't go over 5.26GB.

Answer:

1

The error you're experiencing might be due to the size of the `/dev/sda3` partition exceeding the available space on `/dev/sda1/`. 

One solution is to first shrink the `/dev/sda3` partition to a size that fits within the available space on `/dev/sda1/.`

Here are the steps to shrink the `/dev/sda3` partition:

1. **Shrink the `/dev/sda3` Partition**: Use the `gparted` tool to reduce the size of the `/dev/sda3` partition to a size that fits within the available space on `/dev/sda1`.

Here are the steps to shrink the `/dev/sda3` partition:

1. Open `gparted`.
2. Select `/dev/sda1` as the target partition.
3. Drag the size of the `/dev/sda3` partition to the right until it fits within the available space on `/dev/sda1`.
4. Confirm the reduction of the size of the `/dev/sda3` partition.

By shrinking the `/dev/sda3` partition to a size that fits within the available space on `/dev/sda1`, you can add all the space of the `/dev/sda3` to your `/dev/sda1/`. 

Once you have done this, you can use the following command in the terminal to resize the partition:

```bash
sudo resize2 /dev/sda1
```

This command will resize the partition to fit the available space on `/dev/sda1`.

After shrinking the partition, you can add all the space of the `/dev/sda3` to your `/dev/sda1/` by using the following command in the terminal:

```bash
sudo growroot /dev/sda1
```

These commands will resize the partition to fit the available space on `/dev/sda1` and add all of space of the `/dev/sda3` to your `/dev/sda1/`. 

Ensure to use the commands in the terminal to resize the partition and add the space. 

The answer is 1. 

Note: The above steps should be used in the terminal to resize the partition and add the space. 

The answer is 1. 

To confirm the resizing and adding the space, use the following command in the terminal:

```bash
sudo resize2 /dev/sda1

Options:
A) sudo verify /dev/sda1
B) sudo resize2 /dev/sda1
C) sudo growroot /dev/sda1
D) sudo resize /dev/sda1

The next step is to ensure that all the space on `/dev/sda3` has been added to `/dev/sda1`. The command that should be used in the terminal to ensure the addition of space is the following command in the terminal is:

The answer is C) sudo growroot /dev/sda1.

Question: I am learning StackExchange.Redis, and Kubernetes, so I made a simple .net core app that reads a key/value from a Redis master+2slaves deployed on kubernetes. (so, everything, Redis and my app, run inside containers)

To connect to redis I use the syntax suggested in the doc: 

```
ConnectionMultiplexer.Connect("server1:6379,server2:6379,server3:6379");

```

However, if I monitor the 3 containers with redis-cli MONITOR, the requests are processed always from the master, the 2 slaves do nothing, so there is no load balancing. 

I have tried also to connect to a Kubernetes load balancer service which exposes the 3 Redis containers endpoints, the result is that when I start the .net app the request is processed randomly by one of the 3 Redis nodes, but then always on the same node. I have to restart the .net app and it will query another node but subsequent queries go always on that node.

What is the proper way to read key/values in a load balanced way using StackExchange.Redis with a master/slave Redis setup?

Thank you

Answer:

1111
You are correct. In a master/slave Redis setup, the requests are processed always from the master and the 2 slaves do nothing, so there is no load balancing. I recommend

Question: I'm trying to create a new environment and install various 3rd party packages on an Ubuntu machine. After having to install condo (for a `matplotlib` installation) and `gdal`, the `pip` function no longer works. Instead I receive:

```
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/media/imagery/ENVIRONMENTS/Project_1/bin/pip", line 7, in <module>
    from pip._internal import main
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/__init__.py", line 14, in <module>
    from pip.utils import get_installed_distributions, get_prog
  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/pip/utils/__init__.py", line 30, in <module>
    from pip._vendor.retrying import retry
ImportError: No module named retrying

```

I've called pip both in and outside my environment, and still observe the same issue. Also I've tried a `pip install --upgrade pip` and still retrieve the same Traceback. Any ideas how to resolve this?

Answer:
1. The issue you're encountering is related to how your pip is configured. The key here is that you've tried a `pip install --upgrade pip` and still observe the same traceback. If `pip
